content:
I'm doing some CSS hacking in preparation for a "dark theme" feature. On my branch I moved most of the color-related declarations to separate files that aren't yet in the asset pipeline. So, by accident, you get this somewhat amusing view of what Zulip would look like without any color styling. (There's still color from streams, which have inline colors, avatars, icons, and the blue border.)

pasted image

And display settings:

pasted image

@Steve Howell During the process some colors can be reworked to be partially transparent and be the same color for both light and dark themes. For example, some 'disabled' color can be rgba(127, 127, 127, 0.75) thus on the light theme be lighter and on the dark theme darker than the mid-gray that 127x3 suggests.
@Boris Yankov The first trick that I'm going to try is to take the L component of HSL colors and flip them, doing L = 100 - L figuratively.
I haven't really gotten there yet, though; I'm mostly just re-organizing the files at this point so that color declarations are easy to find.
